page.title: 15WORKING FARMS NEAR POYNTON 1
page.content: Nelson Farm,near Wood Lane Ends,is owned by Mr.Grindey.His farm consisted of almost 63acres,but he rented extra land so that he farmed altogether 200 acres.He had 110 cattle and 70 of them were milkers.The other 40 were heifers and so were too young to have had calves.All Mr.Grindeys cows were Freisans,but he also had a Freisan bull and a Hereford bull.200 gallons of milk was produced each day from his herd of 70 milking cows.Most of the milk was sold to the Milk Marketing Board,who collected it from the farm each day in a tanker lorry.The only other livestock on the farm were sheep.Mr.Grindey and his son worked the farm together.He said that he very much enjoyed his work.
